instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: question what bios need on imac grafic card
threads.message:
hi,

i send a client a working grafik card for 27" 2010 imac 
the card is more little that a 27" 2011 grafik card 
Chip is ...51

the card is working here tested in 27" 2011

Bios has a red point

serial of the machine from my client is W80431VBDB6

not working. is it possible that i have to flash in the bios with the orange point?

the problem is i dont have the machine here and he want to send only the card back.

threads.title: question what bios need on imac grafic card
threads.message: The 9051 cards were made with a VBIOS for LVDS screens (2009 21" only) and eDP screens (2010+) If the card has the old LVDS VBIOS then there will be no image on internal LCD, external should work. But as you tested it in a 2011 and the customer machine is a 2010 it should just work. They probably fucked up the LCD connector as usual.
